info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, EASTERN PENDLETON AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located near Neville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Falmouth, Butler, Neville, Chilo, Mount Auburn, Browning Corner, Woolcutt, Neave, Greenwood, Willow Grove, Bradford, Berlin, Lenoxburg, Kincaid Lake State Park, Peach Grove, Foster, Catawba, Johnsville, and Mckinneysburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
